body_html:
@gchanan
Hmmm, basically what I'm thinking was, I'm trying to JIT some code, below is a demo

import torch

a = torch.randn(5,3)

#@torch.jit.script
def f(x):
    return x[:, None, None, :]

@torch.jit.script
def g(x):
    return x.unsqueeze(1).unsqueeze(1)

print(g(a).shape)

Trying to script f would get a

torch.jit.frontend.NotSupportedError: slicing multiple dimensions at the same time isn't supported yet

and g looks really ugly...
body:
@gchanan 
Hmmm, basically what I'm thinking was, I'm trying to JIT some code, below is a demo

```python
import torch

a = torch.randn(5,3)

#@torch.jit.script
def f(x):
    return x[:, None, None, :]

@torch.jit.script
def g(x):
    return x.unsqueeze(1).unsqueeze(1)

print(g(a).shape)
```

Trying to script `f` would get a
```
torch.jit.frontend.NotSupportedError: slicing multiple dimensions at the same time isn't supported yet
```
and `g` looks really ugly...
